content.description: <math alttext="g of x equals, 2 minus 2 x, for x less than 1; g of x equals, 5 x minus 5, for x greater than or equal to 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace></mspace><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace></mspace><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>x</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: If <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the function defined above, then <math alttext="g prime of 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
